meanings.sent1: She tried to bend the spoon with her hands.
meanings.sent2: He likes to bend paper to make origami animals.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could bend reality with his mind.
meanings.sent4: Her determination could bend even the toughest challenges.
meanings.sent5: The old tree seemed to bend gracefully in the wind.

meanings.definition: A curved or angular shape in something
meanings.sent1: The road took a sharp bend to the left.
meanings.sent2: The metal rod had a slight bend near the end.
meanings.sent3: The bend in the river made a perfect fishing spot.
meanings.sent4: She followed the bend of the path until it disappeared into the forest.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the beauty of the bend in the sculpture.

meanings.definition: To lean or incline in a particular direction
meanings.sent1: He had to bend forward to tie his shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: The tree seemed to bend towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The tower started to bend as if it wanted to touch the ground.
meanings.sent4: His words could bend the opinions of many.
meanings.sent5: The flower would bend gently in the breeze.
